<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In order to turn &quot;IV - Offset &lt; Limit&quot; into &quot;IV &lt; Limit + Offset&quot;, we need</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to be able to freely move values from left side of inequality to right side</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (just as in normal linear arithmetics). Overflows make things much more</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// complicated, so we want to avoid this.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Let&#39;s prove that the initial subtraction doesn&#39;t overflow with all IV&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// values from the safe range constructed for that check.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;Case 1&#93; IV - Offset &lt; Limit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It doesn&#39;t overflow if:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     SINT&#95;MIN &lt;= IV - Offset &lt;= SINT&#95;MAX</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In terms of scaled SINT we need to prove:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     SINT&#95;MIN + Offset &lt;= IV &lt;= SINT&#95;MAX + Offset</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Safe range will be constructed:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     0 &lt;= IV &lt; Limit + Offset</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It means that &#39;IV - Offset&#39; doesn&#39;t underflow, because:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     SINT&#95;MIN + Offset &lt; 0 &lt;= IV</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and doesn&#39;t overflow:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     IV &lt; Limit + Offset &lt;= SINT&#95;MAX + Offset</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;Case 2&#93; Offset - IV &gt; Limit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It doesn&#39;t overflow if:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     SINT&#95;MIN &lt;= Offset - IV &lt;= SINT&#95;MAX</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In terms of scaled SINT we need to prove:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     -SINT&#95;MIN &gt;= IV - Offset &gt;= -SINT&#95;MAX</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     Offset - SINT&#95;MIN &gt;= IV &gt;= Offset - SINT&#95;MAX</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Safe range will be constructed:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     0 &lt;= IV &lt; Offset - Limit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It means that &#39;Offset - IV&#39; doesn&#39;t underflow, because</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     Offset - SINT&#95;MAX &lt; 0 &lt;= IV</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and doesn&#39;t overflow:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     IV &lt; Offset - Limit &lt;= Offset - SINT&#95;MIN</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For the computed upper boundary of the IV&#39;s range (Offset +/- Limit) we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// don&#39;t know exactly whether it overflows or not. So if we can&#39;t prove this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// fact at compile time, we scale boundary computations to a wider type with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the intention to add runtime overflow check.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> getExprScaledIfOverflow = &#91;&amp;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#ac26154a24f393f523c87cc5f8239f36c">Instruction::BinaryOps</a> BinOp,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><Highlight kind="normal">                                     </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><Highlight kind="normal">                                     </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>) -&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsSignedPredicate = MainLoopStructure.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/loopstructure/#a9d7cf70f7880ed211e5469e22d4be373">IsSignedPredicate</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// I think we can be more aggressive here and make this nuw / nsw if the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// addition that feeds into the icmp for the latch&#39;s terminating branch is nuw</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// / nsw.  In any case, a wrapping 2&#39;s complement addition is safe.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;Start = <a href="#a07d028b54d5d81f7eb266f852632d86b">NoopOrExtend</a>(SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a30bd18ac905eacf3601bc6a553a9ff49">getSCEV</a>(MainLoopStructure.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/loopstructure/#a3aae19a5b5699ece3028b57e21f02f0d">IndVarStart</a>),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><Highlight kind="normal">                                   RTy, SE, IsSignedPredicate);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;End = <a href="#a07d028b54d5d81f7eb266f852632d86b">NoopOrExtend</a>(SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a30bd18ac905eacf3601bc6a553a9ff49">getSCEV</a>(MainLoopStructure.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/loopstructure/#acae163992e49f7e3d54f412aa1042a30">LoopExitAt</a>), RTy,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><Highlight kind="normal">                                 SE, IsSignedPredicate);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Increasing = MainLoopStructure.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/loopstructure/#a8e538cdd30086dfdbda1fedeefef7561">IndVarIncreasing</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We compute &#96;Smallest&#96; and &#96;Greatest&#96; such that &#91;Smallest, Greatest), or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;Smallest, GreatestSeen&#93; is the range of values the induction variable</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// takes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;Smallest = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, &#42;Greatest = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, &#42;GreatestSeen = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;One = SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a3fbe8f529d36d76730550905d730a2a7">getOne</a>(RTy);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Increasing) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><Highlight kind="normal">    Smallest = Start;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><Highlight kind="normal">    Greatest = End;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No overflow, because the range &#91;Smallest, GreatestSeen&#93; is not empty.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><Highlight kind="normal">    GreatestSeen = SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a8bcb86d8d126d95b0dc05f09e8f3df96">getMinusSCEV</a>(End, One);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These two computations may sign-overflow.  Here is why that is okay:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We know that the induction variable does not sign-overflow on any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// iteration except the last one, and it starts at &#96;Start&#96; and ends at</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="622"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#96;End&#96;, decrementing by one every time.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="623"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#42; if &#96;Smallest&#96; sign-overflows we know &#96;End&#96; is &#96;INT&#95;SMAX&#96;. Since the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    induction variable is decreasing we know that the smallest value</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    the loop body is actually executed with is &#96;INT&#95;SMIN&#96; == &#96;Smallest&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#42; if &#96;Greatest&#96; sign-overflows, we know it can only be &#96;INT&#95;SMIN&#96;.  In</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    that case, &#96;Clamp&#96; will always return &#96;Smallest&#96; and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    &#91;&#96;Result.LowLimit&#96;, &#96;Result.HighLimit&#96;) = &#91;&#96;Smallest&#96;, &#96;Smallest&#96;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    will be an empty range.  Returning an empty range is always safe.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><Highlight kind="normal">    Smallest = SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#aef6d2bea715d1793e956f41ddeea2320">getAddExpr</a>(End, One);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><Highlight kind="normal">    Greatest = SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#aef6d2bea715d1793e956f41ddeea2320">getAddExpr</a>(Start, One);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><Highlight kind="normal">    GreatestSeen = Start;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="638"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Clamp = &#91;&amp;SE, Smallest, Greatest, IsSignedPredicate&#93;(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;S) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="639"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsSignedPredicate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="640"><Highlight kind="normal">               ? SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a0d1d4b1c8787f465ce2c144757731f12">getSMaxExpr</a>(Smallest, SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a223d678f85ac9b7f03157edb6111e42e">getSMinExpr</a>(Greatest, S))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="641"><Highlight kind="normal">               : SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a238566881f41b81cd8ff51eb1b3f4a8b">getUMaxExpr</a>(Smallest, SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a796339fe5ef91db7de6137a41e23083b">getUMinExpr</a>(Greatest, S));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="642"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="643"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="644"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In some cases we can prove that we don&#39;t need a pre or post loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="662"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="663"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Computes and returns a range of values for the induction variable (IndVar)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in which the range check can be safely elided.  If it cannot compute such a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="665"><Highlight kind="comment">/// range, returns std::nullopt.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="666"><Highlight kind="normal">std::optional&lt;InductiveRangeCheck::Range&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="667" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-inductiverangecheckelimination-cpp-/inductiverangecheck/#a5591acf152c652226d89a2b5ea436d05"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-inductiverangecheckelimination-cpp-/inductiverangecheck/#a5591acf152c652226d89a2b5ea436d05">InductiveRangeCheck::computeSafeIterationSpace</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00668" /><CodeLine lineNumber="668"><Highlight kind="normal">                                               </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevaddrecexpr">SCEVAddRecExpr</a> &#42;IndVar,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00669" /><CodeLine lineNumber="669"><Highlight kind="normal">                                               </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsLatchSigned)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="670"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We can deal when types of latch check and range checks don&#39;t match in case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="671"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if latch check is more narrow.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00672" /><CodeLine lineNumber="672"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;IVType = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;IntegerType&gt;</a>(IndVar-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevaddrecexpr/#a1596600146d065022af8b9c4a1d0b427">getType</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00673" /><CodeLine lineNumber="673"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;RCType = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;IntegerType&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-inductiverangecheckelimination-cpp-/inductiverangecheck/#a6709b9851ee55f06c9515f022c53ec33">getBegin</a>()-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-inductiverangecheckelimination-cpp-/inductiverangecheck/range/#aca7849060290983d710c6194671546f2">getType</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="674"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;EndType = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;IntegerType&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-inductiverangecheckelimination-cpp-/inductiverangecheck/#aa3c6e032de04288a634c923fe14fef30">getEnd</a>()-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-inductiverangecheckelimination-cpp-/inductiverangecheck/range/#aca7849060290983d710c6194671546f2">getType</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00675" /><CodeLine lineNumber="675"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Do not work with pointer types.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="676"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!IVType || !RCType)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00677" /><CodeLine lineNumber="677"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::nullopt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00678" /><CodeLine lineNumber="678"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IVType-&gt;getBitWidth() &gt; RCType-&gt;getBitWidth())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::nullopt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// IndVar is of the form &quot;A + B &#42; I&quot; (where &quot;I&quot; is the canonical induction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00682" /><CodeLine lineNumber="682"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// variable, that may or may not exist as a real llvm::Value in the loop) and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00683" /><CodeLine lineNumber="683"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this inductive range check is a range check on the &quot;C + D &#42; I&quot; (&quot;C&quot; is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="684"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// getBegin() and &quot;D&quot; is getStep()).  We rewrite the value being range</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="685"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// checked to &quot;M + N &#42; IndVar&quot; where &quot;N&quot; = &quot;D &#42; B^(-1)&quot; and &quot;M&quot; = &quot;C - NA&quot;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="686"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="687"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The actual inequalities we solve are of the form</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="688"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00689" /><CodeLine lineNumber="689"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   0 &lt;= M + 1 &#42; IndVar &lt; L given L &gt;= 0  (i.e. N == 1)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00690" /><CodeLine lineNumber="690"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="691"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Here L stands for upper limit of the safe iteration space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="692"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The inequality is satisfied by (0 - M) &lt;= IndVar &lt; (L - M). To avoid</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="693"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// overflows when calculating (0 - M) and (L - M) we, depending on type of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="694"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// IV&#39;s iteration space, limit the calculations by borders of the iteration</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="695"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// space. For example, if IndVar is unsigned, (0 - M) overflows for any M &gt; 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="696"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we figured out that &quot;anything greater than (-M) is safe&quot;, we strengthen</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="697"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this to &quot;everything greater than 0 is safe&quot;, assuming that values between</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="698"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// -M and 0 just do not exist in unsigned iteration space, and we don&#39;t want</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to deal with overflown values.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="700"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="701"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!IndVar-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevaddrecexpr/#a54bb7394d874cbbef1d81e6bea89d4f3">isAffine</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="702"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::nullopt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="703"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="704"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a> = <a href="#a07d028b54d5d81f7eb266f852632d86b">NoopOrExtend</a>(IndVar-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevaddrecexpr/#a19c13fe96d59c787e900b7bbf7173263">getStart</a>(), RCType, SE, IsLatchSigned);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a6a9f043784cf87001c84980afa76da82">D</a> != <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a6a9f043784cf87001c84980afa76da82">D</a>-&gt;getValue()-&gt;isZero() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Recurrence with zero step?&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abee0df5f7f703bb4462aba260ba0a60f">BitWidth</a> = RCType-&gt;getBitWidth();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;SIntMax = SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a2eb94d079d8416118f4aaed865ab05d7">getConstant</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a562c9513409b74f02cb3a5c9bae672ea">APInt::getSignedMaxValue</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abee0df5f7f703bb4462aba260ba0a60f">BitWidth</a>));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;SIntMin = SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a2eb94d079d8416118f4aaed865ab05d7">getConstant</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a8f877403433892e14ff0c692cbe9efdf">APInt::getSignedMinValue</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abee0df5f7f703bb4462aba260ba0a60f">BitWidth</a>));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="721"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Subtract Y from X so that it does not go through border of the IV</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="722"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// iteration space. Mathematically, it is equivalent to:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="724"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    ClampedSubtract(X, Y) = min(max(X - Y, INT&#95;MIN), INT&#95;MAX).        &#91;1&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="725"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="726"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In &#91;1&#93;, &#39;X - Y&#39; is a mathematical subtraction (result is not bounded to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="727"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// any width of bit grid). But after we take min/max, the result is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="728"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// guaranteed to be within &#91;INT&#95;MIN, INT&#95;MAX&#93;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="729"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="730"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In &#91;1&#93;, INT&#95;MAX and INT&#95;MIN are respectively signed and unsigned max/min</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="731"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// values, depending on type of latch condition that defines IV iteration</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="732"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="733"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ClampedSubtract = &#91;&amp;&#93;(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#a262774d3e5186511427e5b2414a85f7f">Y</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="734"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: The current implementation assumes that X is in &#91;0, SINT&#95;MAX&#93;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="735"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is required to ensure that SINT&#95;MAX - X does not overflow signed and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="736"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that X - Y does not overflow unsigned if Y is negative. Can we lift this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// restriction and make it work for negative X either?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IsLatchSigned) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="739"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// X is a number from signed range, Y is interpreted as signed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="740"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Even if Y is SINT&#95;MAX, (X - Y) does not reach SINT&#95;MIN. So the only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="741"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// thing we should care about is that we didn&#39;t cross SINT&#95;MAX.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="742"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// So, if Y is positive, we subtract Y safely.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="743"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Rule 1: Y &gt; 0 ---&gt; Y.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="744"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If 0 &lt;= -Y &lt;= (SINT&#95;MAX - X), we subtract Y safely.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="745"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Rule 2: Y &gt;=s (X - SINT&#95;MAX) ---&gt; Y.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="746"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If 0 &lt;= (SINT&#95;MAX - X) &lt; -Y, we can only subtract (X - SINT&#95;MAX).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="747"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Rule 3: Y &lt;s (X - SINT&#95;MAX) ---&gt; (X - SINT&#95;MAX).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="748"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It gives us smax(Y, X - SINT&#95;MAX) to subtract in all cases.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="749"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;XMinusSIntMax = SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a8bcb86d8d126d95b0dc05f09e8f3df96">getMinusSCEV</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>, SIntMax);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="750"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a8bcb86d8d126d95b0dc05f09e8f3df96">getMinusSCEV</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>, SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a0d1d4b1c8787f465ce2c144757731f12">getSMaxExpr</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#a262774d3e5186511427e5b2414a85f7f">Y</a>, XMinusSIntMax),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="751"><Highlight kind="normal">                             <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa2f7a8775a783f7ea3ad24b3f9cb5d949">SCEV::FlagNSW</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// X is a number from unsigned range, Y is interpreted as signed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Even if Y is SINT&#95;MIN, (X - Y) does not reach UINT&#95;MAX. So the only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// thing we should care about is that we didn&#39;t cross zero.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// So, if Y is negative, we subtract Y safely.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Rule 1: Y &lt;s 0 ---&gt; Y.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If 0 &lt;= Y &lt;= X, we subtract Y safely.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Rule 2: Y &lt;=s X ---&gt; Y.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If 0 &lt;= X &lt; Y, we should stop at 0 and can only subtract X.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Rule 3: Y &gt;s X ---&gt; X.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It gives us smin(X, Y) to subtract in all cases.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a8bcb86d8d126d95b0dc05f09e8f3df96">getMinusSCEV</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>, SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a223d678f85ac9b7f03157edb6111e42e">getSMinExpr</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#a262774d3e5186511427e5b2414a85f7f">Y</a>), <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faafb62cd6afdc004ef6e8a1f6288eb382">SCEV::FlagNUW</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;M = SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a8bcb86d8d126d95b0dc05f09e8f3df96">getMinusSCEV</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEVCheckNonNegative = &#91;&amp;&#93;(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="772"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;One = SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a3fbe8f529d36d76730550905d730a2a7">getOne</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>-&gt;getType());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Can we trivially prove that X is a non-negative or negative value?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af042aac9d86aacb5ee9e1af24590f4c2">isKnownNonNegativeInLoop</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>, L, SE))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Zero;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If not, we will have to figure it out during the execution.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="779"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Function smax(smin(X, 0), -1) + 1 equals to 1 if X &gt;= 0 and 0 if X &lt; 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;NegOne = SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a083bb1deb1d2ba244a99ceae9e734bc1">getNegativeSCEV</a>(One);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#aef6d2bea715d1793e956f41ddeea2320">getAddExpr</a>(SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a0d1d4b1c8787f465ce2c144757731f12">getSMaxExpr</a>(SE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a223d678f85ac9b7f03157edb6111e42e">getSMinExpr</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>, Zero), NegOne), One);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This function returns SCEV equal to 1 if X will not overflow in terms of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// range check type, 0 otherwise.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEVCheckWillNotOverflow = &#91;&amp;&#93;(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// X doesn&#39;t overflow if SINT&#95;MAX &gt;= X.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Then if (SINT&#95;MAX - X) &gt;= 0, X doesn&#39;t overflow</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We use it twice: for X = 0 everything is fine, but for X = getEnd() we can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// end up with a negative X and produce wrong results. So currently we ensure</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that if getEnd() is negative then both ends of the safe range are zero.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
